Description: Plastic female head serving as a foot of Chian, presumable black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery kernos; only the floor of the rectangular tube preserved; white slip; underside and back roughly glazed; at front, from top, flaring headdress decorated with maeander running left above band dots and squares, with added red centres to the black squares; painted facial features and raised dotted necklace; lotus flower with trace of red in right hand pressed to her chest; to either side of face, vertical lines (much effaced) on lightly modelled veil; vertical lines for garment below.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the female figure, see British Museum 1886,0401.1399 and Boston, MFA, 88.926.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1381)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2189) (phase 2)
